item.title: [geolocation-API] Outdated info about what APIs browsers support to query via Permissions API
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Permissions_API/Using_the_Permissions_API

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

About general usage of the API

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

"The only two APIs currently recognized by the Permissions API in Chrome are Geolocation and Notification, with Firefox also recognizing Push and WebMIDI."

It's no longer correct, Firefox already implemented the ability to query the status of Geolocation API, as well as Chrome is implemented the query of the status of Notification API permissions and Web Midi API

What did you expect to see?

I think the better option is to link to the Browser Compatibility table for the reader to refer to. Also, I believe that this cited paragraph can be removed completely because it misleads rather than helpmisleads

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

Cited paragraph: Using_the_Permissions_API
Cited compatibility table: Browser compatibility

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response
